**Create a multiform project using the StreamReader and StreamWriter classes for file operations to save and retrieve data and perform the required operations. Please write non-redundant efficient code.**

The input form is used to take input from the user and the output form displays the data the user has entered via the input form and saved in a file. I have provided you with the interfaces for the two forms.  Please ensure that both forms have your names instead of mine, are centered on the screen when they appear, cannot be resized or minimized or maximized and have operational keyboard access keys as shown in the interfaces. The tabs should only stop on the input fields and the buttons, going top to bottom, left to right on the forms. Output fields must not be editable.

 ![](data:image/*;base64,)

 ![](data:image/*;base64,)

**Instructions: Please place your name, date and purpose at the head of both the files. Provide a detailed explanatory comment at the beginning of each procedure stating its functionality.**

1) The application should start by showing a save file dialog for the user to choose a filename to save data to. The file is opened to write data to. If the file chosen already exists, data should be **appended** to it, if it does not exist, it should be created. If the user cancels the operation, the application stops executing. Please set the properties of this component correctly so that no 'incorrect' messages are displayed.

**Input Form**

2) If the user chooses a filename for saving data, the input form appears for data entry.

a) All fields are required fields. None can be left empty. The employee name and employee number allow any text data and the hours worked can only accept numeric data.

b) If employee name is not provided, display an appropriate error message and bring the focus back to the name field.

c) If employee number is not provided, display an appropriate error message and bring the focus back to the employee number field.

d) The hours worked should only allow numeric input. Display an error message if input is non-numeric; select the contents of the field and focus back on it. Hint: Use a try/catch block to ensure that this requirement is met.

e) Further hours worked should be a value 0 through 40, partial hours allowed. Please use named constants for these limits.  Display an error message if the value is out of limits; select the field and focus on it. Hint: Use an if/else statement inside the try/catch to ensure this requirement is met.

3) The save button allows the user to save the employee information **. If all three pieces of information have been provided and are valid, the employee information is saved in a file.** The input fields are cleared automatically after the Save button is clicked.

4) The Clear button can be used at any time to clear all input boxes. This option does not save the information before clearing the contents on the screen. Please DO NOT restart the application.

5)  When the user has finished entering data, he/she clicks on the Done button.   **The input form is hidden and the output form appears on the screen.**

6) The Exit button or the 'X' causes the application to terminate.

7) All existing open file(s) are closed upon exit.

**Output Form**

**This form automatically uses the data file that was created in the input form data entry. The file name variable in the input form SHOULD BE a private non-static instance variable. You will 'share' the file name and not hard code it yourself in the program code of this class. Hint: Write a set method in the output form to set its file name variable.**

7) The output form appears on the screen. This form outputs all information that has been saved via the input form in the file. In addition, the weekly pay is calculated (hours worked \* 10.50) and displayed on the screen **formatted as a currency value** ($ sign and two places after decimal). Use a named constant for the hourly wage $10.50

8) The first record- employee name, employee number and hours worked from the file and the calculated weekly pay appears on the screen automatically if the file is not empty; else a message box stating the fact that the "Input file is empty" appears on the screen and the application terminates.

9) The Next button shows the next record -employee name, employee number and hours worked from the file and the calculated weekly pay.  The Next button is disabled and the message "No more employee records to display" is shown when all the employee records from the file have been processed.

10) The Exit button or the 'X' closes the application **completely** , closing the hidden input form and the output form.

11) All existing open file(s), if any, are closed when the application terminates.

**Note: All files should be opened and closed as and where**  **required. Open the file once, process the entire data and close the file. Opening and closing of a file multiple times is inefficient and redundant if it is not required. All files must be closed when the application terminates.  The user can always choose to use the 'X' option to close the forms - you should code the corresponding event handler.**

**------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------**

**It is YOUR RESPONSIBILITY to ensure that the zipped file has all the files and it runs successfully in Visual Studio 2013.Net Framework 4.5. I would HIGHLY RECOMMEND that you save it at a different location from where you were working, unzip the file and test that it works, all the code you have written can be viewed and the application runs. I WILL MARK ONLY WHAT IS SUBMITTED TO ME ON BLACKBOARD, AS IS.**

| User cancels the save dialog - application terminates | 1 |

| Done button functionality | 2 |
| Clear button functionality – no application restart please | 1 |
| Exit button functionality | 1 |
| User can choose the 'X' option to close the form – code the event handler | 1 |
| **Output form functionality** |   |
| 'Shares' the file name of the file that was created via the input form | 2 |
| Employee data shown  includes the saved data and the calculated field weekly pay formatted as a currency value | 3 |
| First record appears automatically if the file is not empty. If file is empty, a message appears to that effect and application terminates when user presses the 'OK' button | 2 |
| Next button functionality- shows the next record if any. If all records have been processed, shows a message to that effect and the button is disabled | 2 |
